intro: Syngonanthus gracilis var. luetzelburgii, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist and acidic soils. The varietal form, luetzelburgii, is distinguished by specific morphological traits that set it apart from the typical variety of Syngonanthus gracilis.
